mods.abstract: Theater director and designer, actor, and wood-engraver Edward Gordon Craig began this journal in Florence after working in London and Berlin. Like his lover, Isadora Duncan, he had a “passionate conviction for a unified theatre experience of dance, music, colour, and staging, which crossed national boundaries” (ODNB.) Editorial notes, book reviews, notes on art and theater from England, Russia, Germany, Holland, France, Belgium, Italy, and the United States. Large format, woodcut illustrations, letterpress. Issued in both a popular edition and in deluxe with prints signed by Craig. Contributing writers and artists included Rupert Brooke, Isadora Duncan, Hugo von Hofmannsthal, Jean-Jacques Olivier, and Ellen Terry (Craig’s mother).
mods.note: Issues for 1927 (v. 13) called v. 12 bis on cover.
Issued also on microfilm from University Microfilms International.
